intro: Deprea chotanae, commonly known as the Chotanae bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, high-altitude environments, showcasing its adaptation to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in a fine layer of hair, which helps reduce water loss. Deprea chotanae is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
